meanings.definition: Capable of grasping or holding onto objects.
meanings.sent1: The monkey's prehensile tail helped it swing from branch to branch.
meanings.sent2: The chameleon's prehensile tongue quickly caught the insect.
meanings.sent3: The robot with prehensile arms could easily pick up and move objects.
meanings.sent4: Her prehensile fingers seemed to have a mind of their own, effortlessly grabbing items.
meanings.sent5: The prehensile vines of the plant wrapped around anything in their path.

meanings.definition: Adapted for seizing or grasping, especially by wrapping around an object.
meanings.sent1: The python's prehensile body coiled around its prey, squeezing tightly.
meanings.sent2: The octopus's prehensile tentacles reached out to capture its meal.
meanings.sent3: The prehensile rope twisted around the tree branch, securing the swing.
meanings.sent4: His prehensile grip on the situation allowed him to take control effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The prehensile roots of the tree intertwined with the rocks for stability.

meanings.definition: Able to use hands or feet for holding onto objects.
meanings.sent1: The baby's prehensile toes gripped the edge of the crib as she stood up.
meanings.sent2: The sloth's prehensile claws helped it cling to the tree trunk while sleeping.
meanings.sent3: The prehensile paws of the raccoon made it an expert at opening containers.
meanings.sent4: Her prehensile thumbs made her exceptionally skilled at playing the piano.
meanings.sent5: The prehensile feet of the gecko allowed it to walk effortlessly on walls.
